Description: Lower body sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed (fired reddish) with two added white bands; exterior: two bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Bands on the cul of chalices appear as early as 610BC and last until circa 550BC and appear in the Animal Chalice, Grand and Chalice Styles and on Black Figure Komast and Animal chalices.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0715) (phase 2)
